Header: Writ petition against death penalty moved to tomorrow
Content: The Writ petition filed by journalist Malinda Seneviratne seeking for a court order preventing the implementation of the death penalty has been moved to tomorrow (05). It was done when the petition was summoned in the Appeals Court today. This petition was taken up by the Appeals Court yesterday. The Attorney appearing on behalf of the petition said that the President had no authority to issue an order with respect to the implementation of the death penalty. He pointed out that the duty of the President is to order the date, time and enforcement of the death penalty on whom it has been enforced. Governmentâ€™s Deputy Solicitor General appearing on behalf of the Attorney General filing preliminary objections said that an official task of the president has been queried through the petition. He also mentioned that the Appeals Court had no authority to hear the petition.
